features: Network - Compatible with the AT&T, T-Mobile and Verizon LTE. TCL 30 Z unlocked smart phone has been certified for use on the Verizon LTE network. If your device is not receiving messages or experiences an error when making phone calls on Verizon, your account may need to be provisioned to support "CDMA-less" devices. Please get in touch with Verizon's technical support team or your account's business representative for assistance. Not compatible with CDMA networks (such as Sprint).

6.1" HD+ Vivid Display - The 6.1" HD+ Display with an 85.2% screen-to-body ratio will upgrade your visual experience that is gentle on the eyes. Enjoy immersive visuals with NXTVISION technology. NXTVISION elevates color, contrast, and sharpness to deliver brilliant images and cinema-grade videos. TCL 30 Z unlocked android phone is a US version phone with a 12-month US warranty.

Enjoy More & Keep More - 3GB RAM+ 32GB ROM memory can easily meet your daily needs. Moreover, you can add up to 512GB with a Micro SD card (sold separately). With TCL 30 Z cell phone, you can store massive photos, movies, books, and what you need and love. TCL 30Z is easy to use, making it a great phone for seniors. You could buy it for your kids, parents, grandparents or the elderly. Besides, TCL 30 Z unlocked phone keeps your information and device secure using face unlock.

Long Standby Time - A lasting 3000mAh battery allows you to stay connected all day before needing a charge. Also, the unlocked android phone offers a long standby time (4G: 593H / 4G VOLTE: 562H) and a long talking time (4G VOLTE: 18.7H). And the MTK 6761V_CA chipset and Android 12 smartphone system deliver a smooth and reliable performance.
Capture great moments - Easily navigate the world with the 8MP rear and 5MP front-facing camera. Stay comfortable and browse easily with adaptive modes, improving comfort and readability.

manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: Visuals That Matter Featuring a remarkable 6.1” HD+ display powered by NXTVISION for brilliant visuals and optical comfort. POWERED BY NXTVISION NXTVISION enhances your photos, videos, and games delivering stunning highlights and improved contrast, while also bringing you improved comfort and readability with less optical strain.

POWERFULLY SMART A lasting 3000mAh battery allows you to stay connected all day before needing a charge; quickly and easily optimize your battery for prolonged usage with TCL’s Smart Manager. COMPLETE ANY CHALLENGE MediaTek A22 chipset and quad-core processor deliver a smooth and reliable performance, letting you stay focused on your goals. SPACE FOR IT ALL Download more apps, save more photos, videos, and songs with 32GB of expandable storage1.

SMART AND PRETTY Capable of capturing more than a pretty face; bring the power of Google Lens to the 8MP main camera allowing you to capture and quickly learn about the world around you. CREATIVITY AT YOUR FINGERTIPS Channel your inner artist and create the next viral hit with Light Trace and Stop Motion features. YOU IN THE BEST LIGHT Every side is your good side with a 5MP front-facing camera with portrait mode for simply stunning selfies.

FUNCTIONAL & SECURE Keep your information and device secure using Face unlock. While the low-profile textured design helps keep the phone in place, preventing wobbles and drops, and the Slate Gray honeycomb matte finish makes for a standout accessory.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 20, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Quite a decent little phone
reviews.reviewText: I wanted something small enough to fit in a pocket. This does just that. The screen quality's good. The sound quality's good - could maybe stand to go a little louder, but it's functional. I like that the case forms an edge around the screen, so I can actually hold the thing without accidentally activating something. The battery life is good.My only complaint is that I wish the camera quality was a little better, but I knew that going in.Overall this phone is serving me very well, and an excellent value for the price.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 4, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Works with Mint Mobile
reviews.reviewText: Wanting to change service providers, since the previous never notifies me when minutes, texts, or air time are getting low or are about to expire, I looked for something that was compatible with Mint Mobile and this phone works very well for it. Unlike most, I'm not much of a phone user. I do everything on my desktop for several reasons whenever possible. Still, I use the phone solely for communication purposes, mainly just for calling and occasional text messages and very rarely anything else.Normally, for photos, I use my DSLR as it's greatly superior to just about everything for photos. I've used the camera on this phone a few times, and it's of grade C quality. There are some modest strong points but also some modest weak points. It only goes to 1/15 second for the longest shutter and performs very poorly in low light conditions, also having low contrast. For daylight stuff, it performs quite well though I can see some odd blurring effects even when setting the self timer and resting the phone up against a rock for perfect stability. It's probably the image compression though I'm unsure (JPG using 2x1 subsampling may explain it, instead of the very sharp 1x1). Strangely, there's no control for adjusting the aperture on it (nearly every lens has aperture adjustment, often something like f/3.5 to f/16 or f/22). It may be a software limitation for what's built in. The autofocus is of high quality in daylight settings and bright indoor settings and I love the panorama mode (though it doesn't work for moving scenes such as water waves).

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on June 4, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Perfect Android Smartphone with Affordable Price
reviews.reviewText: I got this smartphone to replace my old iPhone 6s since I wanted to try an Android Smartphone this time. I found several brand new phones from TCL news and eventually chose the A30 one.The phone and its battery were seperately placed in the package box when it was delivered. It was quite easy to assemble the battery into the phone. You can even do that without the quick start guide. The package is also pretty which does not look like just a $100 phone.The cellphone's processing and operations run really smoothly and quickly. You can open multiple apps one time and it will not affect its speed. I downloaded several newly released games such as Diablo Immortal and Genshin Impact, and all of them operated smoothly. The only concern is that the smartphone does not come with an additional RAM disk and it only has 32GB storage. So if you would like to download a lot of games or large apps, I would recommend you to buy another disk and insert it into the phone. A30 does provide a place to insert another memory disk.In addition, it supports multiple Google apps which had been pre-installed on the phone. You don't need to spend a lot of time to find the apps and install them. The battery is also very long-lasting. I used it to play Genshin Impact for several hours with all best graphic setting, it still had much power left.Overall, it's worthy with only $100 to get this impressive phone. If you have a budget plan for your smartphone, I would strongly recommend this TCL A30.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 5, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 1.0 out of 5 stars Stopped working after 10 months. Bad warranty. Never buying TCL again.
reviews.reviewText: I bought this for my daughter who was 13 at the time. It is definitely a cheaply made phone. We have always purchased Samsung Galaxy phones until this one. We purchased because it was a smaller smartphone and my daughter liked that.The phone feels plastic-y and flimsy. The entire time she used it, it was a little glitchy and didn't always connect to the cellular network very well (to be fair, though, she only had 500MB 4g data each month, that then dropped to 2g for the remainder of the month). Her sister's hand-me-down 2016 iPhone has faster connections. The glitchiness was mostly annoying, so we managed it. The battery life was good. Until it wasn't.A few days ago, the phone stopped charging - it was giving a "low battery temperature" warning and wouldn't charge. If plugged in while turned off, the phone would say "Error! Please plug out charger!" Clearly, they are missing some quality control if their grammar is not correct.It was easy to get a hold of tech support at TCL, after doing a factory reset, the issue persisted. They offered to warranty it because it was within a year of purchase, but wanted me to pay $20 for the shipping. That is 25% of what I paid for it.I learned my lesson: TCL = Bad. Stick with Samsung.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 17, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars A very basic smartphone
reviews.reviewText: Let's start with what I like about this item.The cost is first, the lowest cost wins.The phone does work and runs all apps.Now for the dislike of the phoneSlow, like I'm not a flagship phone snob but this is stupid slow. Also need to mention that it may not happen often but apps will quite often simply close when using. Like it starts a task inside the app (open keyboard, microphone, tab switch, that type of thing) will simply cause it to close.Any app that you open will take at minimum 3 seconds to load and about 10 seconds longer if it is a bulky app. Once in an app you do any action and you must wait 1-2 seconds while it processes.If you restart it takes almost 3-5 minutes to load upTheir branding throughout the software resulting in many features being removed such as theme colors and settings.Good thing this is simply a backup phone and would recommend doubling your price and simply getting a phone worth the money. I've been using a Pixel 6a the last few years and refurbished they are around $200 and are snappy and have 128GBs of space dwarfing what you get with this flimsy phone.Overall - If this is a daily use, I would recommend saving your money and saving up for a better one. If it is simply to replace a phone or for a Kid, this would be ideal.

reviews.reviewTitle: Buen precio por la RAM y tamaño. Pero se reinicia de repente. Aún no se por qué.
reviews.reviewText: No se si sea un defecto del hardware o de android 11, pero suele reiniciarse de repente. Me ha pasado al leer Whatsapp o al finalizar una llamada.
